results.title: The Bassoon
results.creator_credit: Muir Mathieson, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and World Mirror-Realist Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “We Make Music”.
The history and technique of the bassoon are explained by Archie Camden, one of the world’s most renowned players of the bassoon. He explains the complex fingering, and demonstrates intonation, staccato playing and trills. Ends with Camden’s famous arrangement of ‘Allegro Spiritoso’ by Senaille.

results.title: Basketball techniques for girls
results.brief_description: This film gives a clear demonstration and explanation of basic skills: Basic movement skills; running, starting, stopping, turning, passing, finger control, movement with the pass, leading the receiver, choice of right pass, shooting, finger control, arm extension wrist flip, choice of the right shot, dribbling, faking and pivoting. No other credits available.

No other credits available.

results.title: Basketball strategy for girls
results.creator_credit: Educational Productions and Young America Films
results.brief_description: The use of planned strategic play on the basketball court. Demonstrates offensive moves such as fakes, rolls, cuts, variances of pace, the figure eight and defence strategies such as player to player and basic zone, shifting zone, triangle, and diagonal defences.

results.title: Basketball fundamentals. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The University of Cincinnati basketball team demonstrate the fundamentals of dribbling, passing, shooting, body handling and defensive play. Practice and drill on each skill can produce expert players. No other credits available.

results.title: The Basket worm
results.brief_description: Describes the life cycle of the basket worm, from chrysalis to moth, how it builds its nest, and where it is found in its natural surroundings. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic strokes
results.creator_credit: Maurice Dybeck, Peter Halket and Explorer Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Canoecraft”.
Shot in both still and fast moving water, shows all the simple skills needed to paddle a canoe. Shows forward strokes, sculling draw, slap support, sculling for support, reverse paddle, sweep stroke, draw stroke, low telemark and hanging draw.

results.title: Basic shots
results.brief_description: Defines and illustrates the range of film shots from very long to very close as used in television production. Discusses basic composition rules for one person, several, groups and crowds. No other credits available.

results.title: Basic parts and threading of the sewing machine
results.brief_description: Illustrates the construction and operation of a Singer 404 sewing machine. Demonstrates the filling of the bobbin and threading of the machine. Close up photography is used to show the position and use of the various parts. No other credits available.

results.title: The Basic elements of production
results.brief_description: Compares the simple production of hand-made pottery with modern mass production methods, showing the basic similarities in the two processes. Emphasizes the interdependence of natural resources, labour, capital, and management in both processes. Explains the role of the consumer in the production of goods and services and in regulating their supply. No credits available.
